events.event_description: OPEC+ announced extension of existing voluntary production cuts through the second quarter of 2024, including additional voluntary cuts from Russia.
events.citation: we expect the March 3 announcement to result in larger cuts to production than we had previously assumed. The announcement includes an additional voluntary production cut from Russia.

events.event_description: EIA increased its Brent crude oil price forecast to average $88/b in Q2 2024, which is $4/b higher than previously forecast.
events.citation: The draw on global oil stocks during 2024 will keep Brent crude oil prices elevated, averaging $88/b in 2Q24, $4/b higher than we had forecast in the February STEO.

events.event_description: Due to recent refinery outages in the United States, EIA increased its regular-grade retail gasoline price forecast by 20 cents per gallon for June, July, and August.
events.citation: Following large planned and unplanned refinery outages in the United States in recent weeks, we increased our refining margin forecast, which is the difference between the wholesale gasoline price and the Brent crude oil price. Both higher crude oil prices and refining margins led us to increase our regular-grade retail gasoline price forecast by 20 cents per gallon for June, July, and August

events.event_description: Ships are rerouting to avoid the Red Sea due to ongoing attacks on commercial shipping, leading to longer trips and increased costs.
events.citation: No crude oil or product tankers have been lost because of the ongoing attacks on commercial shipping in the Red Sea, but many ships are rerouting to avoid the area. Rerouting lengthens the trip and increases costs.
